intro: Porrum, commonly known as the common bean, is a flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its compound leaves and pods that contain edible seeds. The plant is native to the Americas but has been widely cultivated around the world. Porrum typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm and thrives in temperate climates. Its botanical features include a taproot system and a flowering period that varies depending on the climate and variety.
